summary: The term "mass-consumption product" refers to goods that are produced and marketed for widespread use by consumers within the European Union. These products typically encompass a range of items, including food, beverages, and household goods, which are designed to meet the needs of the general populace. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, mass-consumption products are subject to various directives and regulations aimed at ensuring consumer safety, product quality, and environmental sustainability. Compliance with these regulations is essential for manufacturers and distributors to facilitate market access and protect consumer rights across member states.
